title: Ethical Hacking and Penetration Testing
description: Test your knowledge of ethical hacking methodologies, tools, and techniques. This quiz covers reconnaissance, scanning, exploitation, post-exploitation, and reporting.

questions.text: What is the difference between ethical hacking and malicious hacking?

answers.text: Ethical hacking is legal and performed with permission, while malicious hacking is illegal and performed without permission
Ethical hacking uses different tools than malicious hacking
Ethical hacking is always performed remotely, while malicious hacking is performed locally
There is no difference; they are the same thing
A test to measure network speed
A simulated cyber attack against a system to check for exploitable vulnerabilities
A test to measure system performance
A test to verify system compatibility

questions.text: What is the first phase of a penetration test?

answers.text: Exploitation
Scanning
Reconnaissance
Reporting
Gathering information about a target without directly interacting with it
Scanning a target's network for open ports
Exploiting vulnerabilities in a target's systems
Reporting findings to a target
Gathering information about a target without directly interacting with it
Gathering information about a target by directly interacting with it
Exploiting vulnerabilities in a target's systems
Reporting findings to a target

questions.text: What is the purpose of port scanning?

answers.text: To identify open ports and services running on a target system
To exploit vulnerabilities in a target system
To report findings to a target
To gather information about a target without directly interacting with it
The process of identifying security vulnerabilities in systems, networks, or applications
The process of exploiting vulnerabilities in a target system
The process of reporting findings to a target
The process of gathering information about a target without directly interacting with it

questions.text: What is the purpose of the exploitation phase in a penetration test?

answers.text: To identify open ports and services running on a target system
To identify security vulnerabilities in a target system
To attempt to exploit identified vulnerabilities to gain access to a target system
To report findings to a target

questions.text: What is post-exploitation in a penetration test?

answers.text: The process of identifying open ports and services running on a target system
The process of identifying security vulnerabilities in a target system
The process of attempting to exploit identified vulnerabilities to gain access to a target system
The process of maintaining access, escalating privileges, and further exploring a compromised system

questions.text: What is the purpose of a penetration testing report?

answers.text: To document the findings, methodologies, and recommendations from a penetration test
To identify open ports and services running on a target system
To identify security vulnerabilities in a target system
To attempt to exploit identified vulnerabilities to gain access to a target system
